Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by Imam Khalid Latif, Chaplain & Executive Director, Islamic Center at New York University, located at 238 Thompson Street, New York, NY 10012.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Marte.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Imam Khalid Latif, Chaplain & Executive Director, Islamic Center at New York University, located at 238 Thompson Street, New York, N.Y. 10012.

Council Member Marte moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Introduction & Reading of Bills

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to make crime statistics at each New York city housing authority operated housing development available through the department’s website, as well as making other crime information regarding such housing developments available to the city council
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to make crime statistics at each NYCHA operated housing development available through the department’s website, as well as making other crime information regarding such housing developments available to the city council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to signage for automatic doors
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Signage for automatic doors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to establishing an office of Puerto Rico-New York City affairs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Establishing an office of Puerto Rico-NYC affairs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.1866/S.1603, in relation to enacting the NYCHA Utility Accountability Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA Utility Accountability Act (A.1866/S.1603)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to remediating lead water hazards in schools
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Remediating lead water hazards in schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an elected civilian review board and repealing the civilian complaint review board and independent police investigation and audit board
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Withdrawn
Items.MatterName: Creating an elected civilian review board and repealing the civilian complaint review board and independent police investigation and audit board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Mayor of New York City and all private employers in New York City to re-hire all employees fired due to non-compliance with COVID-19 vaccination mandates.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Calling on the Mayor of NYC and all private employers in NYC to re-hire all employees fired due to non-compliance with COVID-19 vaccination mandates.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of sanitation to remove fallen tree limbs, branches and vegetation that obstruct streets and sidewalks as a result of inclement weather
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of sanitation to remove downed tree limbs, branches and vegetation that obstruct streets and sidewalks as a result of inclement weather.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an office of climate resiliency
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Establishing an office of climate resiliency.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain retail food stores to post notices on the food donation web portal concerning the availability of excess food, and arranging for the transportation and retrieval of such food
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain retail food stores to post notices on the food donation web portal concerning the availability of excess food, and arranging for the transportation and retrieval of such food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that traffic study determinations be issued no later than 60 days from the date a traffic control device is requested by a city council member or community board
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring that traffic study determinations be issued no later than 60 days from the date a traffic control device is requested by a city council member or community board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the definition of victim of domestic violence to include economic abuse
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Expanding the definition of victim of domestic violence to include economic abuse.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing transparency around manhole fires and explosions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Increasing transparency around manhole fires and explosions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to electric vehicle charging stations in open parking lots and parking garages
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Electric vehicle charging stations in open parking lots and parking garages.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing minimum neighborhood service standards and requiring environmental mitigation reports on certain large-scale developments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Establishing minimum neighborhood service standards and requiring environmental mitigation reports on certain large-scale developments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (“MTA”) to adjust schedules for distant subway terminal lines to include more peak-direction rush hour trains for commuters to travel to central economic hubs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: MTA to adjust schedules for distant subway terminal lines to include more peak-direction rush hour trains for commuters to travel to central economic hubs.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the continued exploration and feasibility evaluation of the proposed Interborough Express.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Supporting the continued exploration and feasibility evaluation of the proposed Interborough Express.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to expand and make permanent the Atlantic Ticket pilot in order to include Far Rockaway, and other stations along the LIRR corridor, in the fare affordability program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: MTA to expand and make permanent the Atlantic Ticket pilot in order to include Far Rockaway, and other stations along the LIRR corridor, in the fare affordability program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a housing stability program for survivors of domestic and gender-based violence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Establishing a housing stability program for survivors of domestic and gender-based violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the office to end domestic and gender-based violence to create an online services portal and guide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office to end domestic and gender-based violence to create an online services portal and guide.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York State to pass legislation that would provide domestic violence survivors and their families with job-protected, paid leave, similar to that of New York State’s Paid Family Leave law, to be used for any activities relating to their actual or perceived status as a domestic violence survivor or family member of a domestic violence survivor.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Provide domestic violence survivors and their families with job-protected, paid leave, similar to that of NYS Paid Family Leave law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permit filing fees for one-, two-, and three-family dwellings damaged by a fire
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of buildings to waive filing fees for permits to alter family dwellings to conform to the NYC fire code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring carbon monoxide detecting devices in the basements of certain dwellings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring carbon monoxide detecting devices in the basements of certain dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring annual reports on employment turnover of school safety agents and other school safety personnel
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring annual reports on employment turnover of school safety agents and other school safety personnel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a private right of action related to civil immigration detainers and cooperation with federal immigration authorities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Creating a private right of action related to civil immigration detainers and cooperation with federal immigration authorities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the New York for All Act (A.2328-A / S.3076-A), which would prohibit and regulate the discovery and disclosure of immigration status by New York state and local government entities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: New York for All Act (A.2328 / S.3076)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Database and map of media and entertainment production activities.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: 14-day notification requirement for movie-making, telecasting and photography permit applications when special parking requests are required.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this hybrid Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, April 21, 2022.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 103 Lee Avenue, Brooklyn (C 210312 ZMK)

Items.Title: Application number N 210313 ZRK (103 Lee Avenue) submitted by Sbeny Holdings, LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying APPENDIX F for the purpose of establishing a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing area, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 1, Council District 33.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 103 Lee Avenue, Brooklyn (N 210313 ZRK)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Preconsidered M-46 & Res. No. 123,  VOTE: 49-1-0
Negative: CM Barron.

Preconsidered Res. No. 120-A,  VOTE: 45-5-0
Negative: CMs Ariola, Carr, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

L.U. No. 26 & Res. No. 125,  VOTE: 48-1-1
Negative: CM Barron;
Abstention: CM Richardson Johnson.

L.U. No. 27 & Res. No. 126,  VOTE: 48-1-1
Negative: CM Barron;
Abstention: CM Richardson Johnson.










See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
